clues.text: JetBlue gives their economy passengers the most of this, while low cost carriers provide the least: 28 inches to be precise.
This airline is known for their distinctive yellow livery, low fares, and having the highest rate of passenger complaints of any airline.
This airline operates the only scheduled route between Guam and Hawaii (making five stops along the way), referred to as the Island Hooper
The merger of this airline and United in 2010 created the world's largest airline
The United flight between this city in Sonoma Country and San Francisco is the shortest scheduled passenger flight in the continental U.S.
This company wants to make all of the world information searchable and used to have a motto of 'Don't be Evil'.
This maker of CRM software was founded by Marc Benioff and is headquartered in Salesforce
This ~$200B company was founded by Stanford graduates and has a logo featuring of a bridge in the city it's named for
In 1999, if you were looking to place an order for grocery delivery online, you'd turn to this company, which lost over $800M over its five year existence.
This now defunct company was described as 'making the iPhone, but two decades too early' and is where Andy Hertzfeld, Tony Faddel, and Megan Smith worked.
These are the first five prime numbers
These mathematician in 300BC showed that there are infinitely many primes
Except for zero and one, these kinds of numbers are explicitly not prime numbers
Every prime number that is not two is called one of these
This kind of prime is either 2 less or 2 more than another prime number and an unproven conjecture shows that there are infinitely many of these
Since 1900, this political party has had more presidents elected than any other
This president was the last Democrat who won Texas in a presidential election
The US Department of Justice found that this person was the cause of the worst racial profiling in US history and was defeated in 2016 by a Democratic candidate for Sheriff.
This think tank was founded by a Koch brother and is known for pushing limited government, free markets, and downplaying climate change.
This political organization replaced the Federalists and elected the 9th president of the US, William Henry Harrison.
This is a consumer rights organization where you can go to look up complaints about businesses
This home goods retailer is known for mailing out 20% off coupons
These three classical composers are the pre-eminent composers in their field and are referred to as the 'Three Bs'
This kind of company, including Moody's and Standard & Poors, issue grades for investments where a BBB is better than a BB.
The failure of this part of the neuro-immune system is linked with Alzheimer's, Meningitis, and Multiple Sclerosis.
This country is where Pokemon was created where it is known as Pocket Monsters
In Pokemon, Charjabug, Electrike, Larvitar and Scyther are this color, often associated with the Grass type
This Pokemon is literally just a rock with arms
A common Pokemon based on this animal comes in red and blue striped kinds and can be caught with rods
Pokemon shaped like these confections are the only Ice-types found in the Cold Storage and is part of the evolutionary line of Vanillite
Commonly confused for Star Wars, this series created by Gene Roddenberry, features characters like Spock and Picard
This object makes a distinctive hiss when it is worn and is sought by both Kylo Ren and Luke Skywalker
This TV series, adapted from a series of novels by James S. A. Corey, features a conflict between Earth, Mars, and the Outer Planets Alliance.
This film, starring Tim Allen, is best known for the line 'Never Give Up, Never Surrender' and parodies Star Trek
This species, seen in Star Trek's The Next Generation, includes Ro Laren, who has ridges on her nose, and forms part of the Macquis.
This Blizzard first-person shooter game features characters like Tracer and Genji
This developer is known for games “where high culture and pop culture collide” such as Trivia Murder Party, Monster Seeking Monster, and Drawful.
This notorious track, a road named after a meteorological phenomenon, is featured in Mario Kart.
This video game created in 1984 is one the best selling video games of all time and is still played competitively.
This title is given to Mipha, Daruk, Revali, Urbosa, and Link in Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
Antoine de Saint-Exupery’s most famous work is known for its combination of magical realism and philosophy
The Battle Hymn of the Republic inspired the title of this 1939 Steinbeck novel
This Japanese novel is widely considered to be the first written full length novel.
The Battle Hymn of the Republic inspired the title of this 1939 Steinbeck novel
This novel was the first to feature Sherlock Holmes and Dr.Watson
This author of Breakfast at Tiffany’s and In Cold Blood pioneered the style of narrative nonfiction.
This poet who authored 'I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings' was nominated for a Tony, Pulitzer, won three Grammys, and the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
This Bohemian novelist explores byzantine socio-bureaucratic organizations in works like The Trial and Metamorphosis.
This author won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1993 and wrote critically acclaimed novels Song of Solomon and Beloved.
This Jane Austen novel published in 1815 is not Pride and Prejudice but was the last novel published during her lifetime.
This kind of electrical device converts DC to AC and can produce square or sine waves
Isaac Newton, Ge Hong, Paracelsus, Hennig Brand all experimented with this field of research aimed at converting metals.
This American rapper, famous for 'Ridin' and 'Turn it Up' converted from Islam to Christianity at a young age
This company is the worlds largest foreign exchange bureau, you can see their branches at most international airports.
This country was the first to take on metrication in 1795, the process of standardizing on using the Metric system
This international currency was established by the European Central Bank
Control of this canal was handed over on December 31st as part of a treaty agreed to in 1977
This war ended in June of 1999 after NATO intervention and is the subject of war crime tribunals.
This merger between two massive energy companies closed in 1999 to form the world's largest corporation.
A coup in this country ousted Prime Minister Sharif and installed Army General Musharraf who held power until 2008
The Theravada is the older form of this religion and is contrasted by the Mahayana division
